summary: The concept of "legal doctrine" refers to the established principles and theories that underpin the interpretation and application of law within the European Union. It encompasses a body of scholarly work and judicial interpretations that guide legal reasoning and the development of case law. Legal doctrine plays a crucial role in harmonizing diverse legal systems across member states, ensuring consistency in the application of EU regulations and directives. By influencing legislative processes and judicial decisions, legal doctrine serves as a vital source of authority, shaping the evolution of EU law and contributing to the broader understanding of legal frameworks within the Union.
